intro: Atropis californica, commonly known as the California atropis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and coastal scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
